questionText: Which method can you use to transfer all IOTA tokens from an address?
How can you derive an ED25519 IOTA address, and what is the role of the signature scheme flag in this process?

answerOptions.answerText: You need to prepend a flag byte to the public key for all signature schemes, including ED25519
The flag is only necessary for signature schemes other than ED25519; for ED25519, you only hash the public key
You derive the address by appending the private key to the flag and public key for all schemes
There is no need for a flag byte for any signature scheme

questionText: When transferring IOTA tokens, what must you ensure regarding gas fees, and how can you handle transferring all IOTA from an address?

answerOptions.answerText: You can use the same IOTA token object for both the transfer amount and gas fees
You need to ensure a separate IOTA token object is available for gas fees, and you can use the `unsafe_payAllIota` method to transfer all tokens
There are no gas fees for transferring IOTA tokens
You must manually split tokens before each transaction to handle gas fees
